msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; names of the donors of Texts I, II, III-2, III-4a; groups of lines on the incipit page of Texts I, III-1b, III-2, III-4b, incipit of all other texts, incipit of sections of most of the texts and section numbers of Text III-4b; the word sälam "salutation" in Texts III-1b, III-2; directives for the ministers in Text III-1b; elements of the punctuation signs and of the text dividers; Ethiopic numerals (Texts III-1b, III-4b) or their elements in all other texts.

msItem.note: Text III-1b, partly with interlineal musical notation, contains:
- Ṣälotä zä-yǝbǝl ʾǝmqǝdmä yanbǝbu täʾamriha lä-ʾǝgzǝʾtǝnä Maryam ... "Prayer recited before reading the Miracles of our Lady Mary. .." (fols. 12vb-13vb)
- Excerpt from the Gospel of John (Jn. 19:25-27) (fol. 13vb).
- ʾO-ʾǝgzǝʾtǝyä qǝddǝst dǝngǝl bä-kǝlʾe Maryam wäladitä ʾamlak ... "O my Lady, Holy Two-fold Virgin Mary, Godbearing ..." (fol. 15va-vb)
- ʾO-ʾǝgzǝʾtǝyä qǝddǝst dǝngǝl Maryam Mariham ʾǝmmu lä-ʾIyäsus Krǝstos kähali ... "O my Lady, Holy Virgin Mary, Mother of Jesus Christ the Almighty ..." (fols. 15vb-16ra) (cp. ChRep no. 373)
- Sälam läki ʾo-ʾǝgzǝʾtǝyä qǝddǝst dǝngǝl Maryam ʾǝmmä mädḫǝn wä-ʾǝmmä bǝrhan ... "Salutation to you, o my Lady, Holy Virgin Mary, Mother of the Saviour and Mother of the Light ..." (fol. 16ra-vb).
All miracles of St. Mary are numbered.
Miracles 1-3 of Text III-4b are followed by a hymn:
- ʾO-ʾǝgzǝʾtǝyä Maryam ʾǝm-betä mängǝśt wä-ʾǝm-betä kahǝnät ... "O my Lady Mary, from the house of Kingdom and the house of Priesthood ..." (fol. 28va)
- ʾO-ʾǝgzǝʾtǝyä Maryam ḫoḫǝtä mǝśraq zä-täśämäyki ... "O my Lady Mary, Threshold of the East have you been called ... " (fol. 29ra).
- ʾO-ʾǝgzǝʾtǝyä Maryam mälakotawit pilas zä-adḫǝnkiyo ʾǝm-kwǝnäne lä-aḥadu-mänäkos ... "O my Lady Mary, Divine Temple ..." (fol. 29vb)
Fol. 252v contains an ʾarke-hymn addressing different saints and an ownership note, mentioning a certain ʾabunä Täṭämqä Mädḫǝn, son of ʾabba Samuʾel (fol. 252vb).

handDesc.handNote:
Hand a: fine. Hand b: fine. Hand c: mediocre. Hand d: fine. Hand e: neat and regular. Black, red (hand a: strong red, hand b, d and e: vivid red, hand c: strong vermillion). Gäbrä Mädḫǝn, ʾƎśśetä MaryamGäbrä Mädḫǝn is mentioned as the scribe of Text III-1a on fol. 7va, hand c. ʾƎśśetä Maryam is mentioned as the scribe of Text III-4a on fol. 251ra, hand e.Hands a-c: 19th century. Hand d: 16th century. Hand e: 18th century.
In Text III-1b:
ይበል፡ ዲ፡ for ይበል፡ ዲያቆን፡ (fol. 13rb)
Hand a: fols. 2ra-5vb; quire I (Text I). Fine, rounded script with tall, broadly spaced, but irregularly slanted letters.
Hand b: fol. 6ra-vb; quire II (Text II). Regular, with rounded letters.
Hand c: fol. 7ra-vb; quire II (Texts III-1a, IV). Right-sloping letters with notable hairlines.

Hand d: fols. 8ra-13vb, 26ra-215vb, 253ra-254va; quires III, V-XXVIII, XXXIV (Texts III-1b, III-4b). Fine, occasionally irregular (e.g., fols. 80v-83r) script with slender, tall and broadly spaced letters. It shows some distinctive features:
- some letters have the hook vowel marker at the top, not in the middle: e.g., ው, ዮ, ድ, ጽ
- the hook vowel marker of ጵ is attached to the left side of the vertical stroke
- the letters ፅ and ዕ are usually cone-shaped, downward oriented
- archaic forms of numbers ፪, ፬, and ፮.

Hand e: fols. 14ra-25vb, 216ra-251ra; quires IV, XXIX-XXXIII (Texts III-2, III-3, III-4a). The handwriting is characterized by finely shaped, slender and slightly right-sloping letters. Contrary to hand d, the letter መ in all vowel orders is written with the loops separated. The letters ፈ and ረ in all vowel orders and ሥ are formed with a long, diagonal stroke. The vowel marker of ስ is notably long.

And while our mämhǝr was ʾabunä Tärbinos so that it might not be taken out from the house, but it is only for seeing it inside it. (The one who takes it out) shall be excommunicated by the mouth of Our Lady Mary and by the mouth of ʾabunä ʾArägawi and of ʾabunä ʾAḥadu ʾAmlak. And by the mouth of the 15 Prophets and 12 Apostles, by the mouth of the 318 Orthodox [fol. 254vb] (Fathers of Nicaea) and by the mouth of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit. For ever and ever. Amen. The note is hastily written probably in hand d.

Fol. 255ra: Condemnation for those who steal the book.
The unfinished note is written in a mediocre hand, probably in recent time.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards (the back board is broken and crudely repaired) covered with reddish-brown leather (quarter cover). Two pairs of sewing stations.
Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover. Quires XII, XIV and XXXIV are reinforced with parchment guards.

origin.origDate: According to Additio 2, the book was donated in the time of King Lǝbnä Dǝngǝl (r. 1508-40). Quires III, V-XXVIII, XXXIV date to the first half of the 16th cent. Quires IV, XXIX-XXXIII date to the 18th cent. Quires I and II date to a more recent time (19th cent.?). Fol. 252 (with the miniature) originates from an old codex (15th cent.?).

person.persName: ʾAbunä Gäbrä Maryam is mentioned in supplication formulas throughout Text I (hand a). The names Gäbrä Śǝllase and Gäbrä ʾAmlak are written in Text II (fol. 6vb, hand b). ʾAbunä Bǝʾǝse ʾƎgziʾabǝḥer is mentioned as the commissioner in the concluding supplication formula of Text III-4a; furthermore, his name is written throughout Texts III-2 and III-4a (hand e). According to Additio 2, Gäbrä Mänfäs Qǝddus donated the Ms. to Däbrä Dammo; he is also mentioned on fols. 83rb, 215vb (Text III-4b, hand d).
